meanings.definition: A person who causes a complete change in a system or way of thinking.
meanings.sent1: The young inventor became a revolutionizer in the tech industry by introducing groundbreaking ideas.
meanings.sent2: The political leader was known as a revolutionizer for his ability to inspire change in society.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was surprised when the quiet student turned out to be a revolutionizer in the debate competition.
meanings.sent4: Her bold actions as a revolutionizer in the fashion world shook up the industry.
meanings.sent5: The historical figure is remembered as a revolutionizer for challenging the status quo.

meanings.definition: To completely change or transform something.
meanings.sent1: She hoped to revolutionize the way people viewed art by showcasing unconventional pieces.
meanings.sent2: The company aimed to revolutionize its production process to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to revolutionize the traditional recipe by adding a unique twist.
meanings.sent4: His innovative approach revolutionized the field of medicine and saved countless lives.
meanings.sent5: The new technology has the potential to revolutionize the way we communicate.
